turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Last of the Mohicans (1992 film).
turn.1: What was the critical reception of the 1992 film The Last of the Mohicans?
turn.2: Critic Roger Ebert of the "Chicago Sun-Times" gave the film three stars and called it "quite an improvement on Cooper's all but unreadable book, and a worthy successor to the Randolph Scott version," going on to say that ""The Last of the Mohicans" is not as authentic and uncompromised as it claims to be — more of a matinee fantasy than it wants to admit — but it is probably more entertaining as a result." Desson Howe of "The Washington Post" classified the film as "glam-opera" and "the MTV version of gothic romance".
turn.4: Rita Kempley of the Post recognized the "heavy drama," writing that the film "sets new standards when it comes to pent-up passion", but commented positively on the "spectacular scenery".
turn.6: At review aggregation website Rotten Tomatoes the film has a "Certified Fresh" rating of 95% based on reviews from 40 critics, with an average rating of 7.9/10.
turn.7: What was the result of this?
turn.8: The site's consensus states: " The Last of the Mohicans is a breathless romantic adventure that plays loose with history -- and comes out with a richer action movie for it." The film won the Academy Award for Best Sound (Chris Jenkins, Doug Hemphill, Mark Smith, Simon Kaye).
turn.9: Did it win any other awards or nominations?
turn.10: American Film Institute recognition: The film opened in the United States on September 25, 1992, in 1,856 theaters.
turn.11: What else is significant about the reception?
turn.12: It was the number 1 movie on its opening weekend.
